section: Client agrees to pay to Company the sum of $5,000 (the "Contract Price") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
explanation: Section 1 states that the Client agrees to pay a sum of $5,000. Section 2 introduces a contradiction in the original agreement by stating the full amount agreed is to be $4,000. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty in how much is to be paid, which might lead to disputes.

section: Company representatives are available during Company's normal business hours which are 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. UTC +2, Monday through Friday. Any email or telephone correspondence received after normal business hours will be processed the following business day.
explanation: There is conflicting information and ambiguity in the original contract, where the location of business hours states that the work will be processed the next business day, while in the changed section states that business representatives are available at all times. This change introduces uncertainty with when the Client can contact them.

section: Service Provider, either directly or through its authorized vendor, shall provide customer support (the "Customer Support") relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth.
explanation: Section 4 originally makes Customer Service mandatory, stating shall. However, this term is contradicted later in the same section, which states at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service. This creates uncertainty with what is required and given to the Client.
